business_related: The study was discontinued early due to lack of funding and slow enrollment
other: Refusal of CPP to extend the period of inclusion
IRB Approval Lapse - working on resubmission

failed_drugs_analysis.mechanism: Omega-3 fatty acids are believed to exert anti-inflammatory effects and improve endothelial function, potentially leading to vasodilation and reduced blood pressure.
failed_drugs_analysis.biological_insight: The mechanism of action may not have been sufficiently effective in the hypertensive population studied, and the trial was terminated due to funding issues rather than safety or efficacy concerns.

failure_analysis.disease_insights: The failures highlight the complexity of hypertension as a multifactorial disease, where single interventions may not adequately address the underlying pathophysiology, such as vascular remodeling and systemic inflammation.
key_biological_challenges: Need for combination therapies to address multiple pathways

repurposing_candidates.drug: Combined prescription of the individual medications

pdb_structures.title: Structure of human SGLT2-MAP17 complex bound with empagliflozin
Structure of human SGLT2-MAP17 complex with Canagliflozin
Structure of human SGLT2-MAP17 complex with Sotagliflozin
Structure of human SGLT2-MAP17 complex with Dapagliflozin
Structure of human SGLT2-MAP17 complex with TA1887

alternative_targets.rationale: SGLT2 inhibitors have shown promise in reducing blood pressure through diuresis and improved cardiovascular outcomes, addressing fluid overload which is a contributing factor in hypertension.

pdb_structures.title: Structure of human TRPV4 with antagonist A2 and RhoA

alternative_targets.rationale: Targeting endothelin-1, a potent vasoconstrictor, could help mitigate vascular remodeling and systemic inflammation, which are key factors in hypertension.

STRUCTURAL ANALYSIS OF NEPRILYSIN WITH VARIOUS SPECIFIC AND POTENT INHIBITORS

STRUCTURAL ANALYSIS OF NEPRILYSIN WITH VARIOUS SPECIFIC AND POTENT INHIBITORS
Neprilysin in complex with the inhibitor (R)-4-(1-carboxy-3-(3'-chlorobiphenyl-4-yl)propan-2-ylamino)-4-oxobutanoic acid

alternative_targets.rationale: Neprilysin inhibitors can enhance levels of natriuretic peptides, which promote vasodilation and natriuresis, addressing the imbalance in vasodilatory and vasoconstrictive factors in hypertension.

Crystal structure of a CGRP receptor ectodomain heterodimer bound to macrocyclic inhibitor Compound 13
Crystal structure of a CGRP receptor ectodomain heterodimer bound to macrocyclic inhibitor HTL0029881

alternative_targets.rationale: Calcitonin gene-related peptide (CGRP) plays a role in vasodilation; antagonizing its receptor may help in managing hypertension by promoting vascular relaxation.

alternative_targets.rationale: Activating KCNQ potassium channels can lead to hyperpolarization of vascular smooth muscle cells, promoting vasodilation and addressing hypertension.

failed_trials_sample.title: Effect of Fish Oil (Omega-3 Fatty Acids) on Arteries

interventions.name: Omega-3
interventions.description: Subjects meeting eligibility criteria will be randomized to receive a supply of omega-3-acid ethyl esters or placebo, and instructed to take 4 capsules daily. A 3-month supply of study drug will be given following randomization and at 3, 6, and 9 months. Subjects will be asked to bring unused supplies to each quarterly visit for ascertainment of adherence.

primary_outcomes.measure: Change in Pulse Wave Velocity in Active vs. Placebo-treated Patients.
primary_outcomes.description:
We conducted a prospective, randomized; double-blinded study of omega-3 fatty acids among 60 Latino and White hypertensive patients at risk for CVD. Patients received either 4-g omega-3 fatty acids or matched placebo daily. The principal outcome measure was change in brachial-ankle PWV.

.

failed_trials_sample.why_stopped: The study was discontinued early due to lack of funding and slow enrollment

failed_trials_sample.title: Pulmonary Artery Denervation for Treatment of Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension

interventions.name: denervation
interventions.description: The examination proceeds under rigorous aseptic technique. Femoral, jugular or brachial venous access will be performed. A flexible catheter is first introduced across a 7-Fr venous introducer, and passed through the right heart chambers toward the origin of the pulmonary arteries. The pressures in the right heart chambers and the pulmonary artery will be measured. At the end of the examination, the catheter is removed, a dressing is applied and the venous puncture is compressed by hand.

interventions.name: sham procedure
interventions.description:
Right heart catheterism is mandatory in PAH patients care (for diagnosis and during follow-up) and will serve as a " sham " procedure. A usually performed and after a venous punction, cardiac outpout and pulmonary artery pressures will be recorded.

Acoustically isolated headphones will be given to patients during the procedure in order to assure simple-blind during the study.

primary_outcomes.measure: Mean pulmonary artery pressure (in mmHg) measured during right heart catheterization

failed_trials_sample.why_stopped: Refusal of CPP to extend the period of inclusion

failed_trials_sample.title: Biological Sample Repository for Gastrointestinal Disorders

interventions.name: Tissue Sample Collection
interventions.description: Tissue (gastric, duodenum, jejunum and ileum - number of biopsies will be 3-4 from each site, ranging in size from 4-7mm) - These samples collected will be extra biopsies that are taken for research purposes during a clinically planned endoscopy for which biopsies are being planned.

primary_outcomes.description: Blood (10 ml) will be collected from the enrolled subjects, serum will be extracted and stored at -80 degrees for up to 10 years.
Urine (5 ml) will be collected via free catch method and stored at -80 degrees C for up to 10 years.

Tissue samples (gastric, duodenum, jejunum and ileum - number of biopsies will be 3-4 from each site, ranging in size from 4-7mm) will be collected during a scheduled endoscopic examination. Biopsy tissue will be collected with a large capacity biopsy forceps and deposited into a conical vial containing a freshly prepared balanced salt solution including a HEPES buffer at the bedside, using 5mL of buffered salt solution per 5-10 mm3 of tissue biopsy, at 4 degrees C. Tissue will be stored at -80⁰C until they are "used up" or for up to 10 years from collection.

failed_trials_sample.why_stopped: IRB Approval Lapse - working on resubmission
